SENT.plain: The authors observed 6 cases of brain pseudotumours in children aged from 3 to 15 years
All patients had been referred with the diagnosis of brain tumour, with headaches, eye fundus changes fundus changes
Some children had nystagmus, squint, vomiting and dizziness
One child had pharyngitis, two had sinusitis
Contrast brain examinations gave normal results
Diet with salt and fluid restriction and oedema-reducing drugs (glycerol, mannitol, decadron) were used
In all patients the neurological and ophthalmological signs regressed within 3 to 12 weeks
